Detailed Description

Shape XCB Protocol Implementation.

Delivers a request to the X server

Parameters:
c The connection
Returns:
A cookie

Delivers a request to the X server.

This form can be used only if the request will not cause a reply to be generated. Any returned error will be saved for handling by xcb_request_check().

References xcb_shape_combine_request_t::destination_kind, xcb_shape_combine_request_t::destination_window, xcb_shape_combine_request_t::operation, xcb_shape_combine_request_t::pad0, xcb_shape_combine_request_t::source_kind, xcb_shape_combine_request_t::source_window, xcb_shape_combine_request_t::x_offset, and xcb_shape_combine_request_t::y_offset.

)

Return the reply

Parameters:
c The connection
cookie The cookie
e The xcb_generic_error_t supplied

Returns the reply of the request asked by

The parameter e supplied to this function must be NULL if xcb_shape_get_rectangles_unchecked(). is used. Otherwise, it stores the error if any.

The returned value must be freed by the caller using free().

References xcb_shape_get_rectangles_cookie_t::sequence.

xcb_generic_iterator_t xcb_shape_kind_end ( xcb_shape_kind_iterator_t  i  ) 

Return the iterator pointing to the last element

Parameters:
i An xcb_shape_kind_iterator_t
Returns:
The iterator pointing to the last element

Set the current element in the iterator to the last element. The member rem is set to 0. The member data points to the last element.

References xcb_shape_kind_iterator_t::data, xcb_generic_iterator_t::data, xcb_shape_kind_iterator_t::index, xcb_generic_iterator_t::index, xcb_generic_iterator_t::rem, and xcb_shape_kind_iterator_t::rem.

Get the next element of the iterator

Parameters:
i Pointer to a xcb_shape_kind_iterator_t

Get the next element in the iterator. The member rem is decreased by one. The member data points to the next element. The member index is increased by sizeof(xcb_shape_kind_t)

Delivers a request to the X server.

This form can be used only if the request will not cause a reply to be generated. Any returned error will be saved for handling by xcb_request_check().
